pd_0_com_1text:
Hey, remember you told me you wanted to know more about fake information on the internet ? 

-Well I have gathered 5 tips you can use, in order to find fake websites. For example :
pd_0_com_2text:
Now you have to go to the internet hub , and then you can check for uni programs. After that, you can start to gather your documents!. 

And remember ! Be careful with the traffic, you don’t have much time! Come again for the rest of the
pd_0_com_3text:
#1: Pay attention to the address bar
The first thing you want to look for on a website is the https:// at the beginning of the address. The S in https:// stands for secure!
pd_0_com_4text:
#2: Check the domain name
A favorite trick of scammers is to create websites with addresses that mimic those of large brands or companies, or in this case Universities. like THColn.net
pd_0_com_5text:
#3: Watch for poor grammar and spelling.
An excess of spelling, and grammar mistakes could indicate that a website went up quickly. Companies with legitimate websites may certainly have the occasional typo but still put effort into presenting a professional website; Dhuu!
pd_0_com_6text:
Step #4: Look for reliable contact information
Look for several ways to contact the institution.
 (phone, email, live chat, physical address) and try them out. If the only method of contact is an online email form, that's sus!
pd_0_com_7text:
Step #5: Dismiss deals that are too good to be true
This can be more explicit with shopping, but fake universities and agencies as well! If the university has no requirements, or an agency offer to do everything for you, chances are they are cash grabs or scams.
